lookup.item: Add to a New or Existing Portfolio

To create a new portfolio with the selected images, enter a name in the text box and click Submit.
To add the selected images to an existing portfolio, find the portfolio name in the table below and click add.
You may open a portfolio or close this window.
The media was not included due to a lack of access privileges. Sorry. You may view the record.
For help or to request permission to publish:
return to the list of portfolios
When done, all of the images (and/or other media) will reside on your computer for convenient use. HTML pages are also included for viewing records and easy navigation of images.
The download may take several minutes to complete.
Portfolio export functionality is turned off.
Only the first $count items will be downloaded.

Collections are arranged into groups for searching. Click on a group name to search the collections in that group. A collection may include some content outside of the group's definition, and a collection could appear in more than one group. Click the title of a specific collection to search it alone. Sometimes it is advantageous to search a single collection. For example, search field and sorting options are often specific to the collection, allowing for a more refined search.

Some collections have a very narrow focus. Other collections are broader, and may encompass many sub-collections. Occassionally an image appears in multiple collections, though generally there is a single authoritative source for each image.
Select one or more databases to search. Click the database name to search it alone, often in more detail.
To search, enter a word or phrase in a box below and select a field from the menu.
It is not necessary to use more than one box.
You can search all the databases in this group, or use the list of databases to restrict your search to a subset.
select a new group to search

item.p: Matching words: The search engine attempts to match any word or phrase exactly as you put it in the box.
e.g.: Picasso and Rembrandt in a box will look for
Punctuation: All punctuation is treated as an empty space.
Case: The search engine is not case sensitive.
Wildcards: Use wildcard * to expand word stems. This is a good way to search for variations on a word.
Choose image collections: Limit your search to only those collections you choose in the image collections list.

Result.ItemDescription: Lessons from the South / [text and design by Susan E. King]

Values.Value: Lessons from the South / [text and design by Susan E. King]
Atlanta, Ga. : Nexus Press ; Los Angeles : Paradise Press
The leaves are tipped onto a backing strip folded accordion-style and attached to separated upper and lower boards made of corrugated plastic.
"Typset in Goudy Old Style and Roundhand by Mary Neale Meador. Printing by Clifton Meador, assisted by Patrick Dowdey. Binding designed by Hedi Kyle. Bound by hand"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Georgia : a series of prose poems on Georgia O'Keefe / by Susan E. King.

Values.Value: Georgia : a series of prose poems on Georgia O'Keefe / by Susan E. King.
Los Angeles, Calif. : Paradise Press : Women's Graphic Center

"This book was set by hand in Herman Zapf's Palatino type. 300 copies were printed on Kilmory text and bound by Earl Grey Bookbinding Company. 21 copies were printed on handmade Hayle paper and bound in boards"--Colophon.
"This project was supported, in part, by the National Endowment for the Arts, a federal agency"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Say, see, bone : lessons from French / Susan E. King, Jean Gabriel Adloff.

Values.Value: Say, see, bone : lessons from French / Susan E. King, Jean Gabriel Adloff.
"[Adloff's] original pieces appear in French ... My translations appear ... overlaid with his corrections, and my comments on his text"--Notes on Lessons from French.

"Prose pieces ... appear here in American Garamond, printed on Kozo 548 ... paper made by David Carruthers at La papeterie St-Armand in Montreal. My translations appear in 20th Century... The type was set by Mackenzie-Harris Corporation. The decorative papers were made at the Press. The coptic binding was done by hand by Shelley Hoyt"--Notes on Lessons from French.

Result.ItemDescription: The tree house of time / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: The tree house of time / Paul Johnson.
Cheadle Hulme, England : Paul Johnson : The Book Art Project
Book consists of one large, multi-color, double-page pop-up of a fantastic tree house.
Printed in an edition of 10, and signed by the artist.
"Laser printed on mould-made 90 lb. Hahnemuhle Aquarell. Hand assembled. Hand bound on mould-made hand dyed 90 lb. Waterford."--Cover title.

Result.ItemDescription: Sailing to the dance of day / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: Sailing to the dance of day / Paul Johnson.
Cheadle Hulme, England : Paul Johnson : The Book Art Project
Book consists of one large, multi-color, double-page pop-up of a sailing vessel on the sea.
Printed in an edition of 10, and signed by the artist.
"Laser printed on mould-made 90lb Hahnemuhle Aquarell. Hand assembled. Hand bound on mould-made hand dyed 90lb Waterford."--Cover title.

Result.ItemDescription: Flying to the roof of time / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: Flying to the roof of time / Paul Johnson.
Cheadle Hulme, England : Paul Johnson : The Book Art Project
Book consists of one large, multi-color, double-page pop-up of a magical flying machine.
Printed in an edition of 20. Signed and dated by the artist.
"Laser printed on mould-made 90lb Hahnemuhle Aquarell. Hand assembled. Hand bound on mould-made hand dyed 90lb Waterford."

Result.ItemDescription: In this late evening a quiet happiness descends upon us all / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: In this late evening a quiet happiness descends upon us all / Paul Johnson.
Title from inside front cover; artist from inside back cover.

Consists of 16 pages of hand-dyed and inked paper cutouts; bound in same paper over cardboard with ornamental three-dimensional paper figures on spine; wrapped in tie-dyed twine. Issued in black cardboard slipcase, also bound with tie-dyed twine. Title and artist's name hand-written in gold ink.

Result.ItemDescription: I don't know where the idea came from but I knew it was right / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: I don't know where the idea came from but I knew it was right / Paul Johnson.
Title from inside front cover; artist from inside back cover.

Consists of 16 pages of hand-dyed and inked paper cutouts; bound in same paper over cardboard with ornamental three-dimensional paper figures on spine; wrapped in tie-dyed twine. Issued in black cardboard slipcase, also bound with tie-dyed twine. Title and artist's name hand-written in gold ink.

Result.ItemDescription: Put your dreams out to catch the rain drops / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: Put your dreams out to catch the rain drops / Paul Johnson.
Title from inside front cover; artist from inside back cover.

Consists of 16 pages of hand-dyed and inked paper cutouts; bound in same paper over cardboard with ornamental three-dimensional paper figures on spine; wrapped in tie-dyed twine. Issued in black cardboard slipcase, also bound with tie-dyed twine. Title and artist's name hand-written in gold ink.

Result.ItemDescription: Turn over darling / [designed and drawn in wire by Ronald King].

Values.Value: Turn over darling / [designed and drawn in wire by Ronald King].
Embossings on heavy paper, bound in heavy paper self-case and issued in slipcase.
"Printed ... on J. Green RWS hand-made paper, in a signed limited edition of seventy-five copies and on Khadi pure rag-made paper in an unlimited numbered edition"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: So the voice of the spirit sings a melody that only the heart can hear / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: So the voice of the spirit sings a melody that only the heart can hear / Paul Johnson.
Title from inside front cover; artist from inside back cover.

Consists of 16 pages of hand-dyed and inked paper cutouts; bound in same paper over cardboard with ornamental three-dimensional paper figures on spine; wrapped in tie-dyed twine. Issued in black cardboard slipcase, also bound with tie-dyed twine. Title and artist's name hand-written in gold ink.

Result.ItemDescription: Heaven on Earth / Paul Johnson.

Values.Value: Cheadle Hulme, U.K. : The Book Art Project
A miniature pop-up book with tabbed closure, and five small paper ornaments dangling from colorful strings. Includes dark purple paper box.
"50 Copies ... Laser printed on mould-made Hahnemuhle Aquarell. Hand engineered. Hand dyed cotton"--Colophon.
Numbered and signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Paris / Laura Davidson.

Values.Value: "This tunnel book is part of an ongoing series of artists' books referencing old travel guidebooks and maps. This view of Paris is from the top floor of the Institut du Monde Arabe. The images were painted on pagese from Les guides bleus published in 1952"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Access & closure : stories from in and out of an occupied Palestine / Toby Millman ; afterword by Anton Shammas.

Values.Value: Access & closure : stories from in and out of an occupied Palestine / Toby Millman ; afterword by Anton Shammas.
Portland, Oregon : Oregon College of Art & Craft, 2008

"Letterpress printed during an artist residency at the Oregon College of Art & Craft in Portland between August and Decdember of 2008. The title, Access & closure, and the cover images have been drawn from maps produced by the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs for the occupied Palestinian territories"--Colophon.

"... leporello bound and letterpress printed from polymer plates set in Gill Sans Light on Stonehenge paper. The cover, title page and colophon, however, were handset using Gill Sans. The cover is Magnani Pescia and Anton Shammas' afterword is laser printed in Adobe Caslon Pro on Neenah Classic Laid. All the images were traced from original photographs or maps and the written vignettes are one hundred percent true (with a few names changed to protect the semi-innocent). Access & Closure was printed in an edition of 50, five of which are unbound and presented in a clamshell box with a hand-cut map of Palestine on the front"--Author's website.

Result.ItemDescription: Night desert / Rand Huebsch.

Values.Value: Tunnel book: four hand-cut panels, hand-colored with Caran d'Ache crayon; embossments on black museum board; side strips printed with hand-carved rubberstamps and water-based silver block ink.
Title written in pencil on p. [4] of cover.
Publication date from accompanying descriptive materials.
Issued in an edition of 50, signed and numbered by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Entre engañosos velos : poemas / Juana Ines de la Cruz ; con diseño del artista Rolando Estévez.

Values.Value: Entre engañosos velos : poemas / Juana Ines de la Cruz ; con diseño del artista Rolando Estévez.
Juana Inés de la Cruz, Sister

Typescript, with first lines of poems hand lettered, mimeographed on individual leaves of white bond with mimeographed border. Endpapers are black and cream-colored tissue paper; endpapers and colophon have mounted decorated-paper cutouts. Added t.p. has paper collage incorporating photocopied portrait of the author. Stapled at left margin and glued to white coated-paper wrappers. Wrappers have collages of black tissue paper and painted or decorated papers with cheesecloth, thread, and yarn. Front wrapper has oval cutout framing portrait collage of Sor Juana. Facsimiles of Sor Juana's signature appear as mounted cutouts throughout.
Part of a collection of handmade chapbooks, most with cords for hanging (literatura de cordel), published by Ediciones Vigía under the auspices of the Cuban Ministry of Culture.
"Consta de doscientos ejemplares numerados, y totalmente manufacturados pos las Ediciones Vigía [...]"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Connecting the dots / [Tom] Scarpino.

Values.Value: Inkjet printing and red colored pencil; hand-sewn binding. Last leaf serves as back cover.
Signed and dated by the artist on back cover.

Result.ItemDescription: Cibeles que sueña = Cybele, as she dreams / Lourdes Vazquez ; translated by Enriqueta Carrington.

Values.Value: Cibeles que sueña = Cybele, as she dreams / Lourdes Vazquez ; translated by Enriqueta Carrington.

"Este libro fue encuadernado a mano por Yarisa Colón Torres en Trujillo Alto, Puerto Rico durante el mes de abril del año 2010. La cubierta y las páginas fueron pintadas a mano, utilizando soga para imprimir monotipos. La edición consta de 35 ejemplares."-- Colophon.

On handmade paper with hand-painted endpapers. Rectangle of red twine stitched to inside front cover. In hand-painted boards, stitched with gold-painted twine; gold-painted rectangle stitched with red twine mounted to front cover.
1 folded sheet (laid in) with short biographical sketches of author, translator, and binder.
Each book signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Listen, listen : Adadam Agofomma : honoring the legacy of Koo Nimo

Values.Value: Listen, listen : Adadam Agofomma : honoring the legacy of Koo Nimo

"This book was designed by Mary Hark and predominantly showcases paper hand made from botanicals harvested near Koo Nimo's home in Kumasi, Ghana ... Atta Kwami's suite of three etching and relief prints, titled Sound fabric, was printed by Pamela Clarkson and Atta Kwami in their Ayeduase New Site Studio near Kumasi ... on Mary Hark's linen paper. Letterpress printing was executed by Mary Hark and Jana Pullman ... Twi scholars Samuel Kofi Darkwa and Forster Kena Asare assisted in the translation of the lyrics. Layout and typesetting were provided by Christine DeMars. The clam-shell box and small boks were designed by Mary Hark and constructed at HARK! Handmade Paper Studio ... "--Inside front cover of clamshell.

One booklet, in accordion-fold format, titled "Life is what you make it," features text by Koo Nimo in Twi and English; one booklet, titled "Koo Nimo July 2009," features album notes and DVD-ROM of Adadam Agofomma; one booklet, titled "Koo Nimo," features liner notes for the DVD-ROM; one portfolio houses the three prints by Atta Kwami, called "Sound fabric." The whole housed in clamshell case.

Result.ItemDescription: The topography of home.

Values.Value: Limited ed. of 50 copies, numbered and signed by the artist.

"[W]ritten, designed and [letterpress] printed by Macy Chadwick ... Printed with pressure prints and polymer plates on Nohawk Superfine and French's Extra Blue Butcher paper ... Window images hand-stenciled on Silk Tissue." -- Colophon.
Pages attached to a concertina with most pages having a circular silk tissue window so that the preceding and following pages show through.

Result.ItemDescription: [So happy together] / Peter & Donna Thomas.

Values.Value: "Text is the song by the Turtles. A double scrolling structure, with multi-layered color letterpress printing. Illustrations are linoleum cuts made by Donna Thomas, printed letterpress on a Vandercook proof press using a rainbow roll, then hand colored."--Artists' web catalog.

Result.ItemDescription: Housewife is dead / Kerry Johnston.

Values.Value: Hand-colored photographs mounted on stiff paper, with stitched binding; endpapers painted yellow; in portfolio of stiff cream-colored paper over paper boards, with cut-out illustration and title mounted to front cover.

Result.ItemDescription: [Family photos] / Alissa Davis.

Values.Value: P. [3] of cover signed: "12/12/90 Alissa Davis."
Family photos, hand-colored and computer-printed on white paper. Covers of heavy gray apper, bound with black cord; paper-covered stick on front.

Result.ItemDescription: Good will & salvation / [Laura Russell].

Values.Value: "The hand-bound, limited-edition artist book features 36 original photographs by the artist held together at the spine with 11 more photographs of color coordinated clothing racks. Bound using Hedi Kyle's woven accordion structure. Digital archive printing on Moab Entrada and Lasal papers. ... Includes a wrapper with introductory text and colophon"--Colophon.
Limited edition of 25 copies, signed and numbered by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Resilience of Al-Mutanabbi Street / Christine Kermaire.

Values.Value: Resilience of Al-Mutanabbi Street / Christine Kermaire.

Red paper with fragments of quote (in Arabic) from Kant's Critique of pure reason pasted to gray paper. Stitched in red silk thread, with trailing ends; bound accordion-style in covers of black-and-gray houndstooth-print fabric over pasteboard. Housed in a hand-made, balsa wood case (10 x 10 x 3 cm.).

Created for the "An Inventory of Al-Mutanabbi Street" project to commemorate the 2007 car bombing on al-Mutanabbi Street in Baghdad, which was the heart and soul of the Baghdad literary and intellectual community.
Issued in an edition of 300, signed and numbered by the author.

Result.ItemDescription: Hand, voice & vision : artists' books from Women's Studio Workshop / curated by Kathleen Walkup.

Values.Value: Hand, voice & vision : artists' books from Women's Studio Workshop / curated by Kathleen Walkup.
Hand, voice & vision: artists' books from Women's Studio Workshop is a traveling exhibition, held at the Grolier Club and 5 other locations, Dec. 8, 2010-Winter 2013.
Tip-in: "Illustration for page 105: Women's Studio Workshop artist's book details" (1 p.).

Result.ItemDescription: 4 x 4 : [a book of hand printed images on handmade paper produced at the Women's Studio Workshop / by Barbara Leoff Burge ... et al.].

Values.Value: 4 x 4 : [a book of hand printed images on handmade paper produced at the Women's Studio Workshop / by Barbara Leoff Burge ... et al.].
Produced by Barbara Leoff Burge, Ann Kalmbach, Tana Kellner and Anita Wetzel.
"This book is printed in a limited edition of 100 copies."--Colophon.
Twelve leaves, sewn at center; unpaged.

Result.ItemDescription: Age of eruption / Amanda Thackray.

Values.Value: Issued in an edition of 70 copies.
"It was letterpressed and screenprinted on Rives BFK. The text was handset using Bodoni Bold 12- and 24-point typefaces."--Colophon.
Bound in red cloth, with red and white patterned endpapers. A representation of an imprint of teeth is on the front and back covers. Hand sewn.

Result.ItemDescription: Alphabet tricks / by Diane Jacobs.

Values.Value: An alphabet book of sexist language about women.
Limited ed. of 120 copies, signed and numbered by the artist.

"Alphabet Trix was made possible by an artist residency grant from the Women's Studio Workshop in Rosendale, New York. WSW's primary funder is the New York State Council on the Arts. My project was funded by the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts. This book was hand-set in Weiss Roman, Weiss Italic, and wooden type. The cards were printed on Stonehenge and the images were silkscreened on Kozo paper"--Colophon.

Book consists of black cloth-covered boards with attached accordion-folded continuous length of translucent Japanese mulberry paper folded in half lengthwise and sewn at intervals to create pockets for 15 handset, letterpress printed cards. Images on the mulberry paper are two-color silk-screened prints. The cards are positioned so that the top line of text of each card is visible above the pocket. Inset into the front cover is a slightly domed plastic devise with 12 circles that magnify and distort words on the paper lining beneath. Issued in a red cloth-covered slipcase with the alphabet words printed crossword-style on the cloth.

Result.ItemDescription: The angel is my watermark / [Barbara Beisinghoff.].

Values.Value: The angel is my watermark / [Barbara Beisinghoff.].
Inspired by the story "The Angel Is My Watermark" by Henry Miller, about an angel in Paris in the late 1920s, and about the creation of a piece of art.

"The book consists of hand made paper from abaca, cotton linter, raw flax and linen rags. The watermarked sheets are created using flexible screens. The book is concertina bound with multicolored etching, silkscreen and encaustic drawing."--Colophon.
Issued in an edition of 47 copies, numbered and signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: B 11226, fifty years of silence : Eugene Kellner's story / by Tatana Kellner.

Values.Value: B 11226, fifty years of silence : Eugene Kellner's story / by Tatana Kellner.
Czech text in Eugene Kellner's script opposite Tatana Kellner's translation.
Last page, 1/2 cm. thick, includes a three-dimensional forearm and hand, cast in handmade paper, from Eugene Kellner's arm. Text pages are die cut to fit over cast.
Designed and hand printed by Tatana Kellner.

Result.ItemDescription: Plant dreams / Ann Marie Kennedy.

Values.Value: [24] p. : all ill. ; 1 packet of seeds.

The book, with cover of hand-laid paper, is in a wooden box with a sliding glass top and a recessed space (7 x 5 x 1 cm.) in the bottom for the seed packet. Glass top is etched with the word "plant" and seed packet printed with the word "dreams."

"The artist's residency grant during which Plant Dreams was conceived and printed was supported in part with a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts, and the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts"--Inserted note (6 x 5 cm.).
Issued in an edition of 32, numbered and signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: World over world / by Barbara Siegel ; text by Gary Schwartz.

Values.Value: World over world / by Barbara Siegel ; text by Gary Schwartz.

Each of the book's twelve hand-made lithographs is a montage of images culled from old archeology, biology and medical textbooks. Image and text pages are interleaved with transparencies simulating archeological strata and the anatomical overlays in biology textbooks.

The book contains twelve hand-lithographed prints on hand-made Kitakata, Okawara and Goyu Japanese papers. These are tipped onto Rives paper and interleaved with images hand-printed on transparent mylar sheets that interact with both the montaged print and the en face page of poetic text. The twelve alternation text pages are hand-printed directly onto Rives paper to simulate chine collé. Kelly Driscoll of D2 Press lithographed the edition.

Consists of four separate hand-sewn signatures in a hardboard portfolio designed and hand-made by Barbara Siegel in collaboration with Renée Rockoff. The portfolio is covered in light brown handmade Bhutan Tsasho paper inside, beige handmade Himalayan Khadi outside, with black silk cloth spines. On the front of each portfolio is a unique hand-printed paper plaque made by the artist.
Issued in a limited edition of 30, signed by the author and artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Great gams / Tatana Kellner.

Values.Value: Rosendale, N.Y. : Women's Studio Workshop Press
"This book is hand silkscreened in a limited edition of 100 copies. Each copy is numbered and signed by the artist."

Result.ItemDescription: LAP : Loretta's acronym primer / Stephanie Copoulos-Selle.

Values.Value: LAP : Loretta's acronym primer / Stephanie Copoulos-Selle.

"LAP was produced at the Women's Studio Workshop during the snowy winter of 2008. It was digitally and letterpress printed on Rives heavyweight paper using Times New Roman fonts. The images were created with photopolymer plates. Abac and flax handmade paper was used for the covers."--Colophon.
Issued in an edition of 60 copies, numbered and signed by the author.
Hand-bound in dark brown abac and flax handmade paper. Title stamped in gray ink on front cover.

Result.ItemDescription: What's happening with momma? / [Clarissa T. Sligh].

Values.Value: What's happening with momma? / [Clarissa T. Sligh].
"Edition of 150 ... "--Colophon--Hand-written in pencil; signed by the artist.
One cardboard sheet, accordion-folded to form various views of a house, with a story printed on accordion-folded cards which unfold to form a stairway in front of the picture on each page.

Result.ItemDescription: Jeez, knees / Tatana Kellner.

Values.Value: Rosendale, N.Y. : Women's Studio Workshop Press
Issued in an edition of 100 copies, signed by the author.

Result.ItemDescription: Bushspeak : set of 12 hand silkscreened handkerchiefs / Tatana Kellner.

Values.Value: Bushspeak : set of 12 hand silkscreened handkerchiefs / Tatana Kellner.
"A set of 12 handkerchiefs for weeping or display that includes such memorable phrases as: Let them hate us as long as they fear us, from our 43th president."--Publisher.
Silkscreened handkerchiefs 40 x 40 cm., rolled to 16 x 3 cm. each. Hankerchiefs with images alternate with handkerchiefs with text.
Issued in a limited edition of 35 sets, numbered and signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: Shared memories / by Lori Spencer and Wendy Spencer.

Values.Value: Shared memories / by Lori Spencer and Wendy Spencer.
"Published by the Women's Studio Workshop. ... printed in 1998 by Lori Spencer."--Colophon.

On printed, illustrated paper with cut-out in center to reveal childhood portraits of the authors. 2 folds printed with text; cut center section includes childhood stories. Hand-sewn binding. Housed in self-closing portfolio of hand-laid heavy paper.
Issued in an edition of 90 signed and numbered copies.

Result.ItemDescription: Marvel Ann's dream / by Jody Williams.

Values.Value: Marvel Ann's dream / by Jody Williams.
Printed on handmade blue paper with colored graphics; hand-sewn into covers of pale blue stiff paper.
Edition limited to 60 copies, numbered and signed by the artist.

Result.ItemDescription: When you hear this sound / [Keg deSouza].

Values.Value: When you hear this sound / [Keg deSouza].
[32] p. : col. ill. ; 1 sound disc (7 min. : 33 1/3 rpm ; 7 in.)

"When You Hear This Sound is a 'singing book' inspired by the book and record sets of the artist's childhood, complete with a 7" vinyl record soundtrack. When You Hear This Sound explores unique forms of personal storytelling of the artist's Sydney neighborhood and it's characters, through wordplay and quirky observations. Developed from hand drawn illustrations and individually stamped rubber text, the final silk screened product holds true to this aesthetic. The 7" record soundtrack was developed using a Song Poem service. These 'song sharks', as they are sometimes known, are companies that have been operating since the 1950s and market themselves to aspiring songwriters wanting to break into the music industry--you send in your lyrics and for a fee you are sent back a fully produced track. Each story in When You Hear This Sound was sent to Magic Key Records and has been transformed into their own unique song, in a variety of genres. SEE the pictures. HEAR the record. READ the book."--Women's Studio Workshop's website, http://www.wsworkshop.org/, viewed on July 26, 2012.
Issued in an edition of 50 copies, and signed by the artist.
"The images were silkscreen printed on Rives Lightweight paper."--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Opposed to indifference : poems of memory and conscience / Deborah Pease, Rosmarie Waldrop, René Char/Mary Ann Caws, Lee Briccetti, Kathleen Norris, Michael Anania, Jeanne Murray Walker, Catherine Kasper, Lea Graham, David Ray Vance, Ronnie Scharfman ; with a print and vignettes by Ed Colker.

Values.Value: Opposed to indifference : poems of memory and conscience / Deborah Pease, Rosmarie Waldrop, René Char/Mary Ann Caws, Lee Briccetti, Kathleen Norris, Michael Anania, Jeanne Murray Walker, Catherine Kasper, Lea Graham, David Ray Vance, Ronnie Scharfman ; with a print and vignettes by Ed Colker.
Pease, Deborah, Waldrop, Rosemarie, et al.
Fourteen loose leaves printed on one side, enclosed in printed paper wrapper (28 x 45 cm); housed in red cloth portfolio with printed paper frontispiece, brown ribbon ties.

"All texts have been printed as letterpress by Bradley Hutchinson with typography set in Arial, Baskerville, Bauer Bodoni, Bembo, Garamond, Optima and Palatino on acid-free Stonehenge. The color lino-cut frontispiece print is on hand-made St. Armand Caribou. Accompanying vignettes were laser printed by Graphics from the artist's Mylar plates. The binder is wrapped in Canapetta cloth by Portfoliobox ... the edition, signed by the artist, is limited to one hundred twenty-five copies"--Colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: The summons of becoming : marking the centenary of a poet / poems by René Char, translated by Mary Ann Caws with lithographs by Ed Colker.

Values.Value: The summons of becoming : marking the centenary of a poet / poems by René Char, translated by Mary Ann Caws with lithographs by Ed Colker.
"This portfolio edition was conceived to celebrate the centenary of René Char, poet and leader in the French Resistance during World War II."--Colophon.
"The images were hand-colored as pochoir by the artist."
"Text pages and plates are on French Rives BFK papers and the frontispiece, printed by Graphics, is on Canson Mi-Teintes.
Signed by the translator and artist, in pencil, on the colophon.

Result.ItemDescription: Snow bound in September : a re-imagining / by Laurie Whitehill Chong.

Values.Value: Snow bound in September : a re-imagining / by Laurie Whitehill Chong.
[46] leaves : including [14] leaves of color plates ([8] folded), plan ; 1 Map (color ; 27.5 x 21.5 cm., folded to 13.5 x 7.5 cm.)
Map housed in pocket, inside back cover.

"On September 25th, 1915, my grandparents, Robert and Lucia Whitehill, accompanied by two friends, began a three-day recreational hike on several of the highest peaks of the White Mountains of New Hampshire."--Foreword.

"The images are lino-cuts and the text is Book Antiqua, printed from photopolymer plates on Rives lightweight white paper. Images and text were hand-printed on a Vandercook No. 4 Proof Press, in the studio of DWRI Letterpress, under the guidance of Dan Wood and Colin Frazer."--Colophon.
Case bound in linen book cloth, cover includes closing flap.

Result.ItemDescription: Fibre libre / Bridget Elmer ... [et al.].

Values.Value: Accordion-fold binding. Three volumes are bound together. Each section of the book has a removable spine to allow manipulation of the pages from different sides.
Title from sheet inserted in pocket of folding archival container.
"Fibre libre is the first manifestation of the Open Edition project [University of Alabama]."--Colophon.

"Combining the traditional processes of hand papermaking, letterpress printing and bookbinding, with the contemporary processes of coding, digital image-making and desktop publishing..."--Title sheet.

Result.ItemDescription: The Intersection.

Values.Value: "Designed by Kyoko Matsunaga in the spring of 2011"--Inside cover of box.
"Digital print, letterpress. Japanese paper, Bees wax"--Artist's website.
Hand bound with an original accordion technique using paper tabs that attach pages to the accordion. Paper wrapper with a rubber cord.
"Inkjet print, letterpress print on paper. Box: Stonehenge (Fawn), rubber cord /cover: Harukaze /pages: Mitsumata. Hand bound with an original technique"--Information supplied by the artist.

"These photos had been taken every seven seconds during one cycle of the signal at an intersection in Shibuya, Tokyo. Many people and traffics were passing each other, however, no one remembered others. The photos were partially painted out with white color. And at last, everything was disappeared"--Information supplied by the artist.
1st print.: ed. of 10 signed copies; 2nd print.: ed. of 15 signed copies.

Result.ItemDescription: Palpung Parkhang / Clifton Meador.

Values.Value: Printed and produced at the Center for Book and Paper, Columbia College, Chicago.
1 hand sewn binding and 1 stapled fold (notes section); paper cover.

Result.ItemDescription: The moon has no weather.

Values.Value: Rosendale, New York : Sarah Peters, Women's Studio Workshop

"The Moon Has No Weather ... explores the moon as an archive of the entirety of its cosmic history ... The Moon Has No Weather grew from an installation Sarah created at the Minnesota Center for Book Arts while she was experimenting with casting colanders: the resulting paper spheres looked like fragments of satellites or space junk. And her hand-marbled paper resembled the swirling surface of planets seen through telescopes. And there was a gorgeous 1885 book called The Moon Considered as a Planet, a World, and a Satellite. And a podcast about the moon having no weather--no changing atmosphere--to disrupt its atomic material, so that its surface acts as a preserved record of its history. The road was built, and the project was born."--Women's Studio Workshop website, http://www.wsworkshop.org/2013/09/sarah-peters/ , viewed December 24, 2013.
Issued in an edition of 50 copies.
"The Moon Has No Weather was made possible by a grant from the Women's Studio Workshop in Rosendale, NY."--Colophon.

"The text is set in Fox designed by Chad Kloepfer and letterpress printed on Magnani Arturo. Additional papers are Thai mulberry, hand-marbled Hahnemühle Bugra, handmade abaca, acid-free paper from scientific lab books and pages from a 1984 Polish electronics manual. The cover is letterpress on board."--Colophon.
Pages from the lab books and the manual are inter-leaved within the pages of the book.
Cary Collection's copy is no. 43 of 50, and signed by the artist. RVE

Result.ItemDescription: Channel & flow.

Values.Value: RIT Libraries' copy is no. 16. RVE
"Channel and Flow was published by the Women's Studio Workshop in Rosendale, NY ... . The Kidney Press is Sarah McDermott. She made this book in the spring of 2014."
Bound in a modified long-stitch format. Letterpress printed and screenprinted with hand-made paper covers.

Result.ItemDescription: Sometimes I pretend / a poem by Naomi Nye ; handmade paper, illustration, printing & binding by Peter & Donna Thomas.

Values.Value: Sometimes I pretend / a poem by Naomi Nye ; handmade paper, illustration, printing & binding by Peter & Donna Thomas.
Edition of 35 numbered copies, signed by Peter Thomas and Donna Thomas.

"This short poem by Nye has been hand set with various sizes and fonts of wood and metal type and printed as a scroll, in multiple colors using a 'rainbow roll', on Peter's handmade paper. The paper is also illustrated with with two paper pulp stenciled steam punk images made by Donna. Each image was sprayed using 4 colors of pulp through 2 or 3 stencils. The spray pulp was made from old colored rags with no added pigaments. The scroll is bound in a unique box structure made with paper pulp stenciled handmade paper and California walnut. The box also features wooden sprocket cranks made from striaght grain maple, inscribed with the word 'close' and an arrow indicating the direction to rotate the sprocket to return the scroll into the box. There is a pencil attached to the end of the scrolling text to restrain it from slipping into the box"--Artists' website.
